title: Burns and Scalds Treatment
summary: First aid treatment for thermal burns and scalds, including assessment and immediate care.

steps.title: Ensure Safety
steps.description: Remove the person from the heat source. Stop the burning process by removing hot clothing or jewelry unless stuck to the skin. Call 911 for severe burns.

steps.title: Cool the Burn
steps.description: Run cool (not ice cold) water over the burn for 10-20 minutes. This reduces pain, swelling, and the risk of scarring. Do not use ice, butter, or ointments.

steps.title: Remove Constrictive Items
steps.description: Gently remove rings, watches, belts, or tight clothing near the burned area before swelling begins. Do not remove anything stuck to the burn.

steps.title: Cover the Burn
steps.description: After cooling, cover the burn loosely with a sterile, non-stick dressing or clean cloth. Do not use fluffy materials that may stick to the wound.

steps.title: Manage Pain and Monitor
steps.description: Give over-the-counter pain medication if needed. Keep the person warm with blankets (avoid the burned area). Watch for signs of shock.

warnings: Never use ice, butter, oil, or toothpaste on burns
Do not break blisters - they protect against infection
Do not remove clothing stuck to the burn
Avoid using adhesive bandages directly on burns
whenToSeekHelp: Burns larger than 3 inches or deep burns
Burns on face, hands, feet, genitals, or major joints
Signs of infection: increased pain, redness, fever, swelling, or oozing
preventionTips: Keep hot liquids away from table edges
Use back burners when cooking and turn pot handles inward
